Class TCPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • TCPClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TCPClient
extends java.lang.Thread

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  TCPClient.HeartBeat
      This internal class takes care of ping messages that are being sent in order to find out whether or not the server is still online.
      private static class  TCPClient.State
      Different states of the client

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int ALIGN
      left alignment of length of the message
      private boolean disconnect
      flag is the client is disconnected
      private boolean gameIsOn
      flag is the client is playing a game

      thread handling ping messages
      private java.io.BufferedReader input
      reader used to read messages from the socket
      private java.lang.String ip
      ip address of the server
      private Main main
      reference to the main class of the application
      private boolean mainThreadPaused
      flag is the main thread handling the client is paused

      nickname of the user (client)
      private static java.lang.String O_EXIT
      message to leave the server (on purpose)
      private static java.lang.String O_GAME_CANCELED
      message to cancel the game
      private static java.lang.String O_GAME_PLAY
      message to play the game (one turn)
      private static java.lang.String O_NICK
      message to set the user's nickname
      private static java.lang.String O_RPL
      message to either accept or reject a game request
      private static java.lang.String O_RQ
      message to send a game request to another client
      private static java.lang.String O_RQ_CANCELED
      message to cancel a game request
      private java.io.PrintWriter output
      printer used to send messages through the socket
      private boolean player1
      flag which client is up (when playing a game)
      private int port
      port the server runs on
      private boolean previouselyAccepted
      flag if the user already accepted a game request (they cannot spam the button)
      private static java.lang.String PROTOCOL_ID
      id of the protocol
      private java.net.Socket socket
      socket used for the communication with the server
      private boolean starting
      flag if the main thread handling the client should be run again
      private TCPClient.State state
      current state of the client
      private static int THREAD_IS_PAUSED_SLEEP_MS
      when the connection goes off this is the sleep period of the main thread handling the client (until the connection is re-established again)

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the connecting to the server. It closes both the input and output as well as the socket itself

      • run

        The main thread handing the client receiving messages from the server

      • processCommand

        private boolean processCommand(ReceivedMsg msg,
                               java.lang.String[] tokens,
                               java.util.HashSet<ReceivedMsg> prohibited)
        Processes a message received from the server
        Parameters:
        msg - message (enumeration) received from the server
        tokens - the raw message split up into tokens
        prohibited - set of prohibited messages
        Returns:
        false, if the message is on the list of prohibited messages, true otherwise

      • getRecoveryData

        private java.util.List<int[]> getRecoveryData(java.lang.String[] tokens)
        Processes data for game recovery. It parses it from the messages and returns it as a list of coordinates of individual disks on the board.
        Parameters:
        tokens - message split up into tokens
        Returns:
        list of coordinates of the disks on the board

      • getCoordinates

        private java.util.List<int[]> getCoordinates(java.lang.String[] tokens)
        Returns list of coordinates used when highlighting the winning disks (tails)
        Parameters:
        tokens - message split up into tokens
        Returns:
        list of coordinates
